Description: Lower body and foot (mend from numerous fragments with plaster inserts) of Milesian Fikellura pottery oinochoe; white slip; exterior: from top, band of pendent lotus flowers and buds (perhaps the remains of a double band of lotuses); below, billet and square band in between lines; frieze of stalked rosettes with added purple on occasional dots; ribbon pattern; frieze of lotus flowers and buds; dot and billet pattern at foot of wall; inner and outer faces of foot glazed; worn bands on stand-ring; in centre of underside, dot and circle; band at outside of underside.
Curator's comments: Cook placed the oinochoe into his group of 'Miscellaneous Oinochoai'. According to Cook, decoration on underside of the vessel is exceptional in Fikellura. Cook points out that the various design features on the oinochoe are related to earlier patterns. for instance, the ribbon pattern is found on Middle Corinthian vases (595BC-570BC). and the stalked rosette is found on Pre-Fikellura vases from the Plain Body Group (575BC-550BC). Still, he prefers to see a mid-6th century date for this oinochoe.
